revised_title: In vivo Measurement of Oxidation-Reduction Potentials, pH, and Oxygen Tension
tldr: The authors developed an apparatus and techniques to measure oxidation-reduction potentials, pH, and oxygen tension in living tissues. They used this method to study the effects of radiation, radiosensitizing and radioprotecting drugs on tumors and normal tissues. The techniques were also applied to study the influence of hormones on the lactating mammary gland in rats.
